greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k > 0 such that prime(n-k) + prime(n+k) = 2*prime(n), or 0 if there is no such k.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: nn=1000; p=Prime[Range[2*nn]]; Table[s=Take[p,n-1] + Reverse[Take[p, {n+1,2n-1}]]; pos=Position[s,2*p[[n]]]; If[pos=={}, 0, n-pos[[-1,1]]], {n, nn}]
xref: Cf. A178609 (largest k), A178670 (number of k)
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Jan 10 2011
